programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: A seldom-seen ACC showdown begins the 2023 campaign for the No. 9 Tigers and Blue Devils. The two sides have met just twice across the past 15 seasons, with Clemson winning both decisively. Mike Elko led Duke to a 9-4 record and a bowl win in 2022.

programme.title: SportsCenter With Scott Van Pelt
programme.desc: SVP's up at midnight and bringing his unique perspective on games people play to "SportsCenter" viewers. The hourlong, late-night show is driven by the host's self-deprecating wit and passion for sports, with featured elements, including Van Pelt's nightly "1 Big Thing" commentary and a weekly look back at the moments that drove bettors wild in "Bad Beats." The show also delivers what "SportsCenter" fans are used to -- news and highlights, guests and interviews -- but in a different, fast-paced and insightful way.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: Get Up
programme.desc: ESPN's morning show features host Mike Greenberg with a rotating and diverse group of analysts opining about and analyzing the latest news from the world of sports. The two-hour, personality-driven show originates from Manhattan's South Street Seaport, a locale that attracts high-profile guests. Greenberg, aka "Greeny," is formerly one-half of ESPN Radio's longtime "Mike & Mike" morning show.

programme.title: First Take
programme.desc: Stephen A. Smith joins host Molly Qerim on this weekday morning sports debate show. Smith provides his expert takes on the day's trending sports topics and under-the-radar news. They're regularly joined by veteran analysts and the top guests in sports and entertainment.

programme.desc: From the USTA Billie Jean King National Tennis Center in Flushing, N.Y.

programme.title: First Take
programme.desc: Stephen A. Smith joins host Molly Qerim on this weekday morning sports debate show. Smith provides his expert takes on the day's trending sports topics and under-the-radar news. They're regularly joined by veteran analysts and the top guests in sports and entertainment.

programme.title: The Pat McAfee Show
programme.desc: Former NFL punter Pat McAfee brings his humor, sarcasm and candor to the microphone to highlight the day's top stories.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: NBA Today
programme.desc: In-depth, comprehensive daily coverage of all aspects of the NBA from expert analysts.

programme.title: NFL Live
programme.desc: Host Laura Rutledge takes the helm of this weekday show featuring the likes of Marcus Spears, Dan Orlovsky, Mina Kimes, and Adam Schefter. The "NFL Live" crew entertains fans while offering all the latest news and analysis from across the NFL.

programme.title: Around the Horn
programme.desc: Hosted by Tony Reali in the ESPN studio and joined via satellite by four panelists from across the country, the team debates popular sports stories. Reali acts as moderator, giving points for well-made arguments and deducting points for those who inspire him to hit the "mute" button. At the end of the show, whomever Reali deems the winner has 30 seconds without interruption to voice their final opinions on any topic they want.

programme.title: Pardon the Interruption
programme.desc: The debate is the story in this fast-paced, half-hour series hosted by former Washington Post sportswriters Tony Kornheiser and Michael Wilbon. The pair engage in high-energy discussions, conduct interviews and often argue over topics not even related to sports. Other sports reporters appear as guests and offer opinions on the top stories of the day.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: The Buffalo Bills of the early '90s made it to four straight Super Bowls, yet never brought home the coveted Vince Lombardi Trophy.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: Tom Brady and Charles Woodson reflect on the controversial play from a Raiders-Patriots playoff in January 2002 that impacted football history, keying Tom Brady's first postseason win and helping to launch a dynasty under coach Bill Belichick.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: Hard Rock Stadium in Miami hosts this SWAC matchup between Jackson State and Florida A&M. Last season, the Tigers routed the Rattlers 59-3 for a second consecutive season-opening victory. Jackson State pumped South Carolina State 37-7 on Aug. 26.

programme.title: E60
programme.desc: Psychedelics may be the future of mental health treatment in sports. E60 follows a group of former athletes with a range of mental and physical conditions as they take part in a medical retreat involving psilocybin, aka Magic Mushrooms.

programme.desc: All-access to the North Carolina Central University men's basketball program, which looks to become the first HBCU to reach the Sweet 16.

programme.title: NFL Live
programme.desc: Host Laura Rutledge takes the helm of this weekday show featuring the likes of Marcus Spears, Dan Orlovsky, Mina Kimes, and Adam Schefter. The "NFL Live" crew entertains fans while offering all the latest news and analysis from across the NFL.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: A look at the Chicago Bears on the 30th anniversary of their Super Bowl XX win. The birth of Buddy Ryan's 46 Defense, their win over the 49ers, the loss to the Dolphins that ruined their perfect season and the Super Bowl Shuffle.

programme.title: Around the Horn
programme.desc: Hosted by Tony Reali in the ESPN studio and joined via satellite by four panelists from across the country, the team debates popular sports stories. Reali acts as moderator, giving points for well-made arguments and deducting points for those who inspire him to hit the "mute" button. At the end of the show, whomever Reali deems the winner has 30 seconds without interruption to voice their final opinions on any topic they want.

programme.title: Pardon the Interruption
programme.desc: The debate is the story in this fast-paced, half-hour series hosted by former Washington Post sportswriters Tony Kornheiser and Michael Wilbon. The pair engage in high-energy discussions, conduct interviews and often argue over topics not even related to sports. Other sports reporters appear as guests and offer opinions on the top stories of the day.

programme.title: UFC Main Events
programme.desc: Israel Adesanya takes on Anderson Silva at UFC 234, Feb. 9, 2019.

programme.title: UFC Main Events
programme.desc: Showcasing the best fights from recent events, revealing backstories of the athletes and their mindsets.

programme.title: UFC 293 Countdown: Adesanya vs. Strickland
programme.desc: Go inside the lives and training camps of UFC athletes preparing for the next UFC pay-per-view event.

programme.title: Unsportsmanlike with Evan, Canty and Michelle
programme.desc: Start your day off your right with Chris Canty, Evan Cohen and Michelle Smallmon. Sports, life and laughter are what it's all about. Energizing, informative and just want you need to take on the day.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: Get Up
programme.desc: ESPN's morning show features host Mike Greenberg with a rotating and diverse group of analysts opining about and analyzing the latest news from the world of sports. The two-hour, personality-driven show originates from Manhattan's South Street Seaport, a locale that attracts high-profile guests. Greenberg, aka "Greeny," is formerly one-half of ESPN Radio's longtime "Mike & Mike" morning show.

programme.title: First Take
programme.desc: Stephen A. Smith joins host Molly Qerim on this weekday morning sports debate show. Smith provides his expert takes on the day's trending sports topics and under-the-radar news. They're regularly joined by veteran analysts and the top guests in sports and entertainment.

programme.title: College Football Live
programme.desc: Want to know up-to-the-minute reports about your favorite college football team? ESPN has it covered with this weekday studio show, a roundtable format that emphasizes discussion and opinions on the sport's biggest stories and newsmakers. The half-hour program features a rotating roster of analysts that includes coaches, former players, and media personalities.

programme.title: College Football Live
programme.desc: Want to know up-to-the-minute reports about your favorite college football team? ESPN has it covered with this weekday studio show, a roundtable format that emphasizes discussion and opinions on the sport's biggest stories and newsmakers. programme.title: NBA TV Marquee Matchup
programme.desc: Paul George hit a go-ahead jumper with six seconds remaining, finishing with 35 points and six steals as the Clippers edged past the Rockets 95-93 to snap a four-game losing streak. From Oct. 31, 2022.

programme.title: NBA TV Marquee Matchup
programme.desc: Norman Powell scored a season-high 30 points, Reggie Jackson added a season-best 27 and the Clippers rallied in the fourth to defeat the Jazz 121-114. Jordan Clarkson led Utah with 26 points and Lauri Markkanen had 25 and 10. From Nov. 21, 2022.

programme.title: NBA TV Marquee Matchup
programme.desc: Kawhi Leonard had 16 points, including an 18-foot jumper with 1.4 seconds remaining to lift the Clippers to a 119-117 victory over the Hornets in his return from a right ankle sprain. From Dec. 5, 2022.

programme.title: NBA Playoff Playback
programme.desc: Blake Griffin scores 24 points, Chris Paul has 22 points and 14 assists, and the Los Angeles Clippers outlast the Golden State Warriors 126-121 in Game 7 to win their thrilling first-round playoff series.

programme.title: NBA TV Marquee Matchup
programme.desc: Kawhi Leonard continued his hot play with 30 points, Paul George had 24 and the Clippers overcame Stephen Curry's 50-point night to beat the Warriors, 134-126. Curry tied a season high with the 12th 50-point game of his career. From March 15, 2023.

programme.title: NBA TV Marquee Matchup
programme.desc: Norman Powell scored 27 points, Kawhi Leonard added 25 in a game-high 43 minutes and the Clippers improved their playoff seeding chances with a 125-118 win over LeBron James and the Lakers. From April 5, 2023.
